alert.note: Alert for St. Marys (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 17 at 11:00PM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM EST MONDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southern Maryland, including the following county, St. Marys. * WHEN...Until 500 AM EST Monday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1100 PM EST, Gauge reports indicated that stream levels are approaching flood stage. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Lexington Park... Chesapeake Ranch Estates... Leonardtown... Piney Point... Tall Timbers... Greenwell State Park... White Point Beach... Town Creek... Cuckold Creek... Saint Leonard Creek... Sheridan Point... Hallowing Point... Saint Marys City... Saint Inigoes Creek... California... Golden Beach... Lusby... Hollywood... Patuxent River Naval Air Station...Drum Point... - Please visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for flood safety and preparedness information
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
